intro: Moorea, commonly known as the "Island of the Gods," is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the genus *Pandanus*, which includes a variety of tropical plants characterized by their palm-like appearance. The plant features long, narrow leaves that are often used in traditional crafts and ceremonies. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a distinctive aromatic scent. Moorea is well adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat.
